{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3483354,"name":"Patrick Hurley","username":"phurley67","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/phurley67/{size}/7559_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T15:01:55.350Z","cooked":"

Are there any custom controls for either that would allow for a relatively high density display of either a boolean array or distinct boolean values?

Ideally we would like to display a ring corresponding to a single level, e.g. L4, L3, etc. with status lights for each of the 12 positions.

This is a very interesting idea. I’ll look into implementing this into QFRCDashboard soon for boolean array values.

Since you’re looking at 12 values, I assume you want to be able to lay it out as a grid?

Does FMS provide enough real-time data to showcase where coral is scored?

Or is this for you to just note yourself what was scored?

Also I imagine it would be easier next month knowing how the field is going spit out which spots were scored. (Similar to the grid in 23)

FMS knows the info but doesn’t provide it. What would be cool is a camera feed that would pull the data from the alliance station sign that has the info

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-01-16T21:34:16.979Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481888,"topic_slug":"in-elastic-or-qfrcdashboard-displaying-reef-status","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19411,"username":"Dominick_Ferone","name":"Dominick Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/in-elastic-or-qfrcdashboard-displaying-reef-status/481888/9","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3484979,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T21:34:48.519Z","cooked":"

At present, there doesn’t appear to be anything sent to the robot indicating where coral has already been scored. That would be really cool if it was a thing however; at present it seems like manual tracking would be the only way to do so. This may not be too cumbersome if the status lights are also big buttons that the drive coach can press via a touchscreen.

How would we request that the FMS provide that data?

The FMS wouldn’t track exactly where each coral is scored, only corals scored on each level.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-01-16T21:36:27.417Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":37.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481888,"topic_slug":"in-elastic-or-qfrcdashboard-displaying-reef-status","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/in-elastic-or-qfrcdashboard-displaying-reef-status/481888/11","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3484983,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T21:37:01.697Z","cooked":"

G430 says coaches are hands off the control.

I know technically this isn’t controlling anything directly but idk if it would be allowed to have them contact anything connected to the drivers station during a match.

It has been requested before (fairly frequently I believe). Emailing team advocate and surveys are probably the best avenue.

Are you sure? Haven’t prior years showcase where objects were scored in 19 and 23 for example.

Or is that just the scoring data kept separately?
